summary_detail.value: There is a public meeting tonight at 6:00PM at the Sula Community Clubhouse in Sula.Current Size:  28,914 acres  Resources Assigned: 292      Status: The fire is burning in mixed conifer stands, primarily lodgepole pine, with many standing dead trees. There are residences at risk in the vicinity of the fire in the areas of Moose Lake, Frog Pond, Springer Memorial Park and Bonanza.     Yesterday’s Activities: Significant fire activity occurred yesterday as a result of dry, hot conditions and tinder-dry fuels responding to gusty, erratic winds. The eastern edge of the fire south of Moose Lake extended well beyond the primary containment line. The slop over caused a temporary closure of the Moose Lake Rd while officials re-assessed the threat to the Moose Lake community which remains, for the moment, in a pre-evacuation warning status. Slower rates of fire towards the Springer Memorial and Bonanza areas has allowed firefighters to identify and implement structure protection...

title: Meyers Fire Update for September 1, 2017 (Meyers Fire Wildfire)
